intro: Malcolmia binervis, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a sprawling growth habit and is often found in rocky or dry soils. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton. Malcolmia binervis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
